Description: St Antony; the saint stands in the centre with a staff in his right hand, behind him to the right stands a pig, to the left kneels a man raising one hand, in the upper left corner God appears from a cloud, in the right corner a scroll is placed with the name "S. ANTONIUS" and to this two feet and hands are suspended Woodcut with hand-colouring, mounted on vellum
Curator's comments: The print has been given Schreiber's no. 1127, but that entry refers to a bad impression with slightly different dimensions. Cf. 1845,0724.4 on the same mount.
Bibliographic references: Schreiber 1926-1930 / Handbuch der Holz- und Metalschnitte des XV Jahrhunderts (1227)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Donated by: Henry Van den Bergh
Acquisition notes: Bought for donation to the BM: see Dodgson's report dated 1 March 1930.
